creator: fpahl@web.de
text:
If you a apply an empty filter (i.e. one with no filter primitives)
to a rectangle fill, the element is drawn unfiltered and unclipped.
The spec doesn't explicitly state what to do about empty filters.
Adobe SVG Viewer doesn't show the element at all, but it seems a
more natural extension of the general behaviour to this special
case to pass the source graphics through unfiltered. (I've submitted
a request for clarification of the spec.) The spec is also not very
clear on the meaning of the filter effects region in this case, but
it seems the more natural interpretation of Section 3.7 and the
first sentence of Section 15.5 that applying a filter clips the
results to the filter effects region, even if the filter is empty.

To summarize, neither behaviour is explicitly mandated by the spec,
but it seems to me that Batik is right about using the unfiltered
source graphics but wrong about not clipping.

creator: deweese@apache.org
cam@apache.org
text:
This was responded to by the WG here:

  http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/www-svg/2004Feb/0051.html

It seems that elements that are filtered by an empty <filter> element should
not have any output (since the initial transparent black buffer is the output
of the filter).  This behaviour is now fixed in SVN.
